pullRequest.body:
Add lemma about ker and range of DirectSum.map.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [e350e38550](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22705/commits/e350e38550924d9fbe1314847071364b8ee07806)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coeFnAddMonoidHom`
`+ ker_map`
`+ ker_mapRangeAddMonoidHom`
`+ mker_map`
`+ mker_mapRangeAddMonoidHom`
`+ mrange_map`
`+ mrange_mapRangeAddMonoidHom`
`+ range_map`
`+ range_mapRangeAddMonoidHom`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Sorry,  maybe I didn't get it clear, do you mean by adding the corresponding lemma for `DFinsupp` and apply to the current case and the one you mention?

I mean both:
* Drop all the `mem_ker` lemmas in favor of just writing lemmas of the form `ker (map f) = _`
* Write these lemmas for `DFinsupp` first, then copy them across to `DirectSum` as a one-liner.
Sorry that I forgot to ask: what is `mker`? I didn't find it.
`AddMonoidHom.mker` and `AddMonoidHom.mrange` are the "monoid" versions of the `m`-less "group" versions.

As a reminder from an earlier tangential comment hiding in a thread:

> I think you should repeat all these results [...] for `mker` too

i.e. the `AddSubmonoid` versions.

I think you're duplicating a fair bit of the work that `AddSubmonoid.pi` does here. Can I suggest something more along the lines of:
```lean
import Mathlib

variable { : Type*} {M :   Type*} {N :   Type*} [ i, AddCommGroup (M i)]
variable [ i, AddCommGroup (N i)] (f : (i : ), M i + N i)

namespace DFinsupp

lemma ker_mapRangeAddMonoidHom : (mapRange.addMonoidHom f).ker = (AddSubgroup.pi Set.univ (f  |>.ker)).comap DFinsupp.coeFnAddMonoidHom := by
  ext
  simp [AddSubgroup.mem_pi, DFinsupp.ext_iff,
    -- TODO: remove after #22984
    DFinsupp.coeFnAddMonoidHom]

end DFinsupp

namespace DirectSum

@[simps!]
def DirectSum.coeFnAddMonoidHom : ( i, N i) + ( i, N i) where
  toFun x := x
  __ := DFinsupp.coeFnAddMonoidHom

lemma ker_map : (map f).ker = (AddSubgroup.pi Set.univ (f  |>.ker)).comap DirectSum.coeFnAddMonoidHom := by
  convert DFinsupp.ker_mapRangeAddMonoidHom f
```
As a general rule, if you're proving anything about the module or additive group structure of `DirectSum`, you should prove it for `DFinsupp` first.

As a reminder from an earlier tangential comment hiding in a thread:

> I think you should repeat all these results [...] for `mker` too

i.e. the `AddSubmonoid` versions.
Does this need a new section? It would be better to reuse the `M` variable above, rather than use the less clear `` you use here.
I agrre that the notation should change, however I need AddCommGroup, but the module above doesn't, I think I still need new variable. What do you think I should rename them into?
At any rate, I think you should repeat all these results (or rather, my suggested replacement for them below) for `mker` too, which would use the old variable
Sorry, how? I didn't find any place in  `DFinsupp` importing `AddMonoidHom.ker`
Where does `#find_home` suggest you put such a lemma?

`#find_home` suggest that no imported of `DirectSum.Module` satisfy the condition.
I didn't find a good place for it.
Let's put the theorems at the top of this file for now then, and see if reviewers have suggestions for better homes.
My `#find_home` once broked, I don't know if it is working now. If it didn't break, then I'll leave it there.
My `#find_home` once broked, I don't know if it is working now. If it didn't break (I believe so), then I'll leave it there for now.
Can you prove this for `DFinsupp` first too?
You should remove these `Decidable` assumptions, and replace them with `classical` in the proof.
Should this be done every where? Similarly in my other PRs?

Yes, certainly in your open PRs. If you spot existing lemmas that should be generalized that aren't related to your open PRs, feel free to create a new PR just removing the assumptions.

Note that this applies only to `classical`; you shouldn't be adding `open scoped Classical in`.
One maybe unrelated problem : what about the existing `[DecidableEq ]` scattered almost every where in the lemmas about `DirectSum`? Should they all be removed and use classical?

I think you'll find many of them cannot be replaced by `classical` in the proof. The rule is "Only use `Decidable` arguments if your _statement_ requires it". If only your proof requires it, that's a job for `classical`.
Got it, thank you.

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/DirectSum): add lemma about ker and range of DirectSum.map
